title: Phase 1: Walking Skeleton -- Session List and Attach
Go Module and Cobra Root Command
description:
**Problem**: No Go project exists yet. Portal needs an initialised Go module with a CLI framework (Cobra) and the portal open subcommand wired up as the entry point for the TUI.

**Solution**: Initialise a Go module, add Cobra as a dependency, and create the root command (portal) with an open subcommand that prints a placeholder.

**Outcome**: go build produces a portal binary. portal open prints a placeholder message and exits cleanly.

**Do**:
- Run go mod init github.com/leeovery/portal
- Add Cobra dependency: go get github.com/spf13/cobra@latest
- Add Bubble Tea dependency: go get github.com/charmbracelet/bubbletea@latest
- Create main.go calling cmd.Execute()
- Create cmd/root.go with root Cobra command
- Create cmd/open.go with open subcommand
- Ensure go build ./... and go vet ./... pass

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] go.mod exists with module path github.com/leeovery/portal
- [ ] go.sum exists and Cobra + Bubble Tea are listed as dependencies
- [ ] go build -o portal . produces a binary without errors
- [ ] ./portal open prints a placeholder message and exits with code 0
- [ ] ./portal --help shows usage including the open subcommand
- [ ] go vet ./... reports no issues

**Tests**:
- root command executes without error
- open subcommand is registered on root
- open subcommand executes without error

**Spec Reference**: .workflows/specification/portal/specification.md -- Architecture, CLI Interface, Dependencies sections.

title: tmux Session Listing and Parsing
description:
**Problem**: Portal needs to query tmux for running sessions and parse the output into structured data. The tmux command may fail if no server is running.

**Solution**: Create a tmux package with ListSessions() that runs tmux list-sessions -F '#{session_name}|#{session_windows}|#{session_attached}', parses each line into a Session struct. Handle no-server case by returning empty slice.

**Outcome**: Tested tmux package with ListSessions() returning []Session with Name, Windows, Attached fields. Returns empty slice and nil error when no server running.

**Do**:
- Create internal/tmux/tmux.go with Session struct: Name string, Windows int, Attached bool
- Define Commander interface with Run(args ...string) (string, error) for testability
- Create Client struct with ListSessions() ([]Session, error)
- Implement parsing: split by newlines, parse pipe-delimited fields
- Handle non-zero exit (no server) -> return empty slice, nil error
- Create RealCommander using os/exec
- Create internal/tmux/tmux_test.go with MockCommander

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Session struct with Name, Windows, Attached fields
- [ ] ListSessions() correctly parses multi-session output
- [ ] Returns empty slice and nil error when tmux exits non-zero
- [ ] Attached is true when session_attached > 0
- [ ] All tests pass

**Tests**:
- parses multiple sessions correctly
- parses single session
- returns empty slice when tmux server is not running
- returns empty slice when output is empty
- attached is true when session_attached > 0
- attached is false when session_attached is 0
- handles session name with special characters

**Edge Cases**:
- No tmux server running: non-zero exit -> empty slice, nil error
- Empty session list: empty output -> empty slice

**Spec Reference**: .workflows/specification/portal/specification.md -- Session Info Display, Session Discovery, tmux Integration sections.

title: Session List TUI Model
description:
**Problem**: Portal needs a full-screen Bubble Tea TUI that displays running tmux sessions. The portal open command needs to launch a Bubble Tea program that fetches sessions and renders them with name, window count, and attached indicator.

**Solution**: Create a Bubble Tea model in internal/tui/ that takes a tmux Client, calls ListSessions() on init, and renders a full-screen list. Wire portal open to launch with tea.NewProgram(model, tea.WithAltScreen()).

**Outcome**: portal open launches full-screen TUI. Sessions appear in list with name, window count, attached indicator. First session highlighted by default.

**Do**:
- Create internal/tui/model.go with Model struct: sessions []tmux.Session, cursor int, tmuxClient
- Implement Init() returning command to fetch sessions
- Define sessionsMsg type for async result
- Implement Update() to handle sessionsMsg
- Implement View() to render session list with cursor indicator, name, window count, attached indicator
- Use Lip Gloss for styling
- Update cmd/open.go to create Client, Model, and run tea.NewProgram
- Create internal/tui/model_test.go

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] portal open launches full-screen alternate-screen TUI
- [ ] Sessions appear with name, window count, attached indicator
- [ ] Window count uses correct pluralisation (1 window vs N windows)
- [ ] Attached sessions show indicator; detached do not
- [ ] First session highlighted by default (cursor at 0)
- [ ] All tests pass

**Tests**:
- view renders all session names
- view shows window count for each session
- view shows attached indicator
- cursor starts at first session
- single session renders correctly
- long session name renders without truncation

**Edge Cases**:
- Single session in list: must render correctly
- Long session names: render fully, no truncation

**Spec Reference**: .workflows/specification/portal/specification.md -- TUI Design, Session Info Display, Sorting sections.

title: Keyboard Navigation
description:
**Problem**: TUI renders a session list but does not respond to keyboard input for navigation. Users need to move cursor up/down using arrow keys and vim-style j/k keys.

**Solution**: Add key message handling to Update function. Handle up/k (move up), down/j (move down). Clamp cursor to [0, len(sessions)-1].

**Outcome**: Arrow keys and j/k move cursor through session list. Cursor wraps at boundaries. View reflects cursor position after each keypress.

**Do**:
- In internal/tui/model.go, extend Update to handle tea.KeyMsg
- For KeyDown and 'j': increment cursor if cursor < len(sessions)-1
- For KeyUp and 'k': decrement cursor if cursor > 0
- Ensure cursor clamped: never < 0, never > len(sessions)-1
- When len(sessions) == 0, navigation is no-op
- Add tests in internal/tui/model_test.go

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Down arrow or j moves cursor to next session
- [ ] Up arrow or k moves cursor to previous session
- [ ] Cursor does not go above first item
- [ ] Cursor does not go below last item
- [ ] View shows highlight on new cursor position
- [ ] All tests pass

**Tests**:
- down arrow moves cursor down
- j key moves cursor down
- up arrow moves cursor up
- k key moves cursor up
- cursor does not go below last item
- cursor does not go above first item
- navigation is no-op with single session
- view highlights correct row after navigation

**Edge Cases**:
- Single-item list: up/down are no-ops, cursor stays at 0

**Spec Reference**: .workflows/specification/portal/specification.md -- Keyboard Shortcuts section.

title: Quit Handling
description:
**Problem**: TUI has no way to exit. Users need to quit cleanly with q or Esc.

**Solution**: Add q and Esc key handling to Update. Return tea.Quit to cleanly exit and restore terminal state.

**Outcome**: Pressing q or Esc exits program cleanly. Terminal restored to normal state. Process exits code 0.

**Do**:
- In internal/tui/model.go, extend Update to check for 'q' rune and tea.KeyEsc
- When detected, return model and tea.Quit
- Also handle tea.KeyCtrlC for robustness
- Add tests in internal/tui/model_test.go

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] q exits TUI and returns to shell
- [ ] Esc exits TUI and returns to shell
- [ ] Ctrl+C exits TUI and returns to shell
- [ ] Update returns tea.Quit when quit key pressed
- [ ] Terminal state restored after quit
- [ ] All tests pass

**Tests**:
- q key triggers quit
- Esc key triggers quit
- Ctrl+C triggers quit
- navigation keys do not trigger quit

**Spec Reference**: .workflows/specification/portal/specification.md -- Keyboard Shortcuts section.

title: Attach on Enter
description:
**Problem**: TUI displays and navigates sessions but Enter does nothing. The core flow -- selecting a session and attaching -- is missing.

**Solution**: Handle Enter key in Update. Store selected session name, send tea.Quit, then after program exits call syscall.Exec to replace Portal process with tmux attach-session -t <name>.

**Outcome**: Enter on highlighted session quits TUI and attaches to that tmux session via exec. Portal process replaced by tmux.

**Do**:
- In internal/tui/model.go, add selected string field
- Handle tea.KeyEnter: if sessions loaded and cursor valid, set m.selected = m.sessions[m.cursor].Name, return tea.Quit
- Add Selected() string method for caller to retrieve chosen session
- In cmd/open.go, after tea.NewProgram().Run() returns, check model.Selected()
- If non-empty, call syscall.Exec with tmux attach-session -t <name>
- Use exec.LookPath("tmux") to find binary path
- If LookPath fails, print "Portal requires tmux. Install with: brew install tmux" and exit 1
- If Selected() empty (user quit), exit cleanly with code 0
- Add tests in internal/tui/model_test.go

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Enter sets selected session and triggers tea.Quit
- [ ] After TUI exits, syscall.Exec invoked with tmux attach-session -t <name>
- [ ] Portal process replaced by tmux (exec, not subprocess)
- [ ] Quitting without selecting does not trigger attach
- [ ] Enter with zero sessions is no-op
- [ ] All tests pass

**Tests**:
- Enter sets selected session and triggers quit
- Enter with no sessions is a no-op
- quit without selecting leaves selected empty
- selected returns correct session after navigation and Enter

**Spec Reference**: .workflows/specification/portal/specification.md -- Keyboard Shortcuts, Running Inside tmux, Process Handoff, tmux Integration sections.

title: Empty State Display
description:
**Problem**: When no tmux sessions exist, TUI shows empty list with no indication. User needs clear message: "No active sessions".

**Solution**: In View(), check if sessions loaded (via loaded bool flag) and slice empty. When both true, render "No active sessions" instead of session list.

**Outcome**: When portal open runs with no sessions, TUI displays "No active sessions". User can still quit with q/Esc.

**Do**:
- In internal/tui/model.go, add loaded bool field, initially false
- In Update, when handling sessionsMsg, set m.loaded = true
- In View, if m.loaded && len(m.sessions) == 0, render "No active sessions"
- Quit keys still work in empty state
- Navigation and Enter are no-ops in empty state (already handled)
- Add tests in internal/tui/model_test.go

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] No sessions displays "No active sessions"
- [ ] No tmux server (empty slice returned) displays "No active sessions"
- [ ] Empty state message appears only after sessions fetched
- [ ] Quit keys work in empty state
- [ ] All tests pass

**Tests**:
- empty sessions shows no active sessions message
- non-empty sessions does not show empty message
- empty state is not shown before sessions are loaded
- quit works in empty state
- Enter is no-op in empty state

**Edge Cases**:
- tmux server disappears between list and display: handled at attach layer (tmux reports error)

**Spec Reference**: .workflows/specification/portal/specification.md -- Empty States, Session Discovery sections.

title: Phase 2: New Session from Directory -- Project Memory and Session Creation
Git Root Resolution
description:
**Problem**: When a directory is selected for a new session, Portal must resolve it to the git repository root. Non-git directories used as-is.

**Solution**: Implement ResolveGitRoot function using git -C <dir> rev-parse --show-toplevel. Return original dir on failure. Use CommandRunner interface for testability.

**Outcome**: Tested, reusable function that resolves any directory to its git root or returns unchanged for non-git directories.

**Do**:
- Create internal/resolver/gitroot.go with ResolveGitRoot(dir string) (string, error)
- Use exec.Command for git command
- On success (exit 0), return trimmed stdout
- On failure (any non-zero exit), return original dir unchanged with no error
- Check directory existence before running git
- Accept CommandRunner interface for testing

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] ResolveGitRoot returns git root for subdirectory of git repo
- [ ] ResolveGitRoot returns original dir for non-git directory
- [ ] ResolveGitRoot returns original dir when git not installed
- [ ] No user-facing output during resolution

**Tests**:
- resolves subdirectory to git repository root
- returns original directory for non-git directory
- returns original directory when git is not installed
- trims whitespace from git output
- returns error when directory does not exist

**Spec Reference**: .workflows/specification/portal/specification.md -- Git Root Resolution section

title: Session Name Generation
description:
**Problem**: Portal needs to auto-generate unique tmux session names in format {project-name}-{nanoid}. Project name must be sanitised (no periods or colons), and collisions must be handled.

**Solution**: Implement GenerateSessionName function that sanitises name, appends 6-char nanoid, checks for collisions, retries up to 10 times.

**Do**:
- Create internal/session/naming.go
- SanitiseProjectName: replace . and : with -
- GenerateSessionName(projectName, exists func) returns unique name
- Injectable nanoid generator for testing

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Returns name matching pattern {project}-[a-zA-Z0-9]{6}
- [ ] Periods replaced with hyphens
- [ ] Colons replaced with hyphens
- [ ] Retries on collision
- [ ] Error after max retries

**Tests**:
- generates name in correct format
- sanitises periods/colons
- retries on collision
- returns error after max retries

**Spec Reference**: .workflows/specification/portal/specification.md -- Session Naming section

title: Project Store (projects.json)
description:
**Problem**: Portal needs to persist remembered project directories in projects.json at ~/.config/portal/.

**Solution**: Implement ProjectStore with CRUD operations. Load handles missing/malformed files gracefully. Save uses atomic writes. Upsert by path. List sorted by last_used.

**Do**:
- Create internal/project/store.go
- Project struct: Path, Name, LastUsed
- Load(): handle missing file, malformed JSON
- Save(): create dir, atomic write (temp+rename)
- Upsert(path, name): add/update project
- List(): sorted by last_used descending
- Remove(path): delete entry

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Load returns empty list when file missing
- [ ] Load returns empty list for malformed JSON
- [ ] Save creates config directory
- [ ] Upsert adds new or updates existing
- [ ] List sorted by last_used descending

**Tests**:
- loads empty list when file does not exist
- loads projects from valid JSON
- handles malformed JSON
- creates config directory on save
- upsert adds/updates project
- list returns sorted projects

**Spec Reference**: .workflows/specification/portal/specification.md -- Configuration & Storage, projects.json Structure

title: Stale Project Cleanup
description:
**Problem**: Project directories can be deleted after being remembered. Stale projects should be automatically removed when project picker is displayed.

**Solution**: Implement CleanStale() method on ProjectStore. Check each directory with os.Stat, remove non-existent ones, retain permission-denied dirs.

**Do**:
- Add CleanStale() (int, error) to ProjectStore
- Iterate projects, os.Stat each path
- If os.IsNotExist, mark for removal
- If permission error, keep the project
- Save only if changes made
- Return count of removed

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Removes projects with non-existent directories
- [ ] Retains projects with existing directories
- [ ] Retains projects with permission denied
- [ ] Returns 0 when no stale projects

**Tests**:
- removes project with non-existent directory
- retains project with existing directory
- retains project with permission denied
- returns zero on empty list
- removes multiple stale in single call

**Spec Reference**: .workflows/specification/portal/specification.md -- Stale Project Cleanup section

title: Session Creation from Project
description:
**Problem**: Portal needs to create a new tmux session from a project directory, orchestrating git root resolution, name generation, project store update, and tmux command.

**Solution**: Implement SessionCreator.CreateFromDir that coordinates the full flow: resolve git root, derive project name, generate session name, upsert project, create tmux session.

**Do**:
- Create internal/session/create.go
- SessionCreator struct with dependencies: GitResolver, ProjectStore, TmuxClient
- CreateFromDir(dir): resolve git root, derive name from basename, generate session name, upsert project, call tmux NewSession
- Extend TmuxClient: HasSession(name) bool, NewSession(name, dir) error
- Validate directory exists before tmux call

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Resolves directory to git root
- [ ] Generates session name from basename with nanoid
- [ ] Upserts project in store
- [ ] Creates tmux session with correct name and dir
- [ ] Works when no tmux server running
- [ ] Returns error when directory missing

**Tests**:
- creates session with git-root-resolved directory
- derives project name from basename
- generates unique session name
- upserts project in store
- handles tmux server not running
- returns error for non-existent directory

**Spec Reference**: .workflows/specification/portal/specification.md -- New Session Flow, How Directories are Added

title: Project Picker TUI View
description:
**Problem**: Portal needs a project picker TUI showing remembered projects sorted by recency with browse option at bottom and empty state handling.

**Solution**: Implement ProjectPickerModel as Bubble Tea component. Display projects from store, always show browse option, handle empty state.

**Do**:
- Create internal/ui/projectpicker.go with ProjectPickerModel
- Init: call store.CleanStale(), store.List()
- Render: header, project list with cursor, separator, browse option
- Navigation: Up/Down/j/k, Enter selects, Esc returns
- Empty state: "No saved projects yet." with browse still visible
- Return selection message (project path or browse action)

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Displays projects sorted by last_used
- [ ] browse option always visible at bottom
- [ ] Arrow keys and j/k navigate list
- [ ] Enter on project returns selection
- [ ] Enter on browse returns browse action
- [ ] Esc returns to session list
- [ ] Empty state with browse still selectable

**Tests**:
- displays projects sorted by last_used
- shows browse option at bottom
- empty state shows message
- enter on project emits path
- esc emits back message

**Spec Reference**: .workflows/specification/portal/specification.md -- Project Picker Interaction, Empty States

title: Main TUI New in Project Integration
description:
**Problem**: Main session list needs [n] new in project... option that transitions to project picker. After selection, create session and attach.

**Solution**: Extend Phase 1 session list with new option below divider, wire n shortcut, implement view switching between session list and project picker.

**Do**:
- Add [n] new in project... option below sessions with divider
- n shortcut jumps to the option
- View states: viewSessionList, viewProjectPicker
- Enter on option switches to project picker
- Esc in picker returns to session list
- Project selection triggers SessionCreator.CreateFromDir then tmux exec
- Browse action is placeholder for Phase 3

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] [n] new in project... appears below sessions with divider
- [ ] n key jumps to new option
- [ ] Enter on option transitions to project picker
- [ ] Selecting project creates session and attaches
- [ ] Esc in picker returns to session list
- [ ] Empty session list still shows option
- [ ] Combined empty state (no sessions + no projects) navigable

**Tests**:
- session list includes new in project option
- n key jumps to option
- enter switches to project picker
- esc returns to session list
- project selection triggers creation
- empty session list shows option

**Spec Reference**: .workflows/specification/portal/specification.md -- TUI Design, Keyboard Shortcuts

title: Phase 3: File Browser and CLI Quick-Start
Directory Listing Model
description:
ListDirectories(path, showHidden) returns []DirEntry (directories only). Handles empty dirs, permission denied, symlinks.

**Do**:
- Create internal/browser/listing.go
- Read directory entries, filter to directories only
- Option to include/exclude hidden (. prefix)
- Sort alphabetically
- Return empty slice on permission denied

**Tests**:
- returns only directories
- excludes hidden when showHidden=false
- includes hidden when showHidden=true
- returns empty for empty directory
- handles permission denied gracefully

title: File Browser TUI -- Core Navigation
description:
Bubble Tea FileBrowserModel for directory navigation. Enter/right descends, Backspace/left ascends. Shows . entry for current dir.

**Do**:
- Create internal/ui/browser.go
- Init with starting path (cwd)
- Render: current path, dir listing with cursor, . entry at top
- Enter/right on dir: descend into it
- Backspace/left: go to parent (no-op at root)
- Up/Down/j/k: navigate listing

**Tests**:
- displays current path
- enter descends into directory
- backspace goes to parent
- no-op at root directory
- cursor navigation works

title: File Browser Inline Filter
description:
Typing narrows listing by fuzzy match. Backspace: remove char, or navigate to parent if filter empty. Esc: clear filter, or cancel browser if no filter.

**Do**:
- Add filter state to browser model
- Typing adds to filter string, narrows visible entries
- Backspace on non-empty filter removes char
- Backspace on empty filter goes to parent
- Esc clears filter if active, cancels browser if not
- Filter resets when entering a subdirectory

**Tests**:
- typing filters directory listing
- backspace removes filter char
- backspace on empty filter goes to parent
- esc clears active filter
- esc cancels browser when no filter
- filter resets on directory change

title: File Browser Hidden Directory Toggle and Selection
description:
. key toggles hidden dir visibility. Space/Enter on . entry selects current directory for session creation.

**Do**:
- . key toggles showHidden flag (only when not filtering)
- Space on . entry: select current dir, emit selection message
- Enter on . entry: same as Space
- Validate directory exists before selection
- Selection triggers auto-add to projects.json (via integration)

**Tests**:
- dot key toggles hidden visibility
- space on dot entry emits selection
- enter on dot entry emits selection
- selection message contains current path
- dot key ignored when filtering

title: File Browser Integration with Project Picker
description:
Wire browse for directory option to file browser. Selection flows through git root, project registration, session creation.

**Do**:
- Project picker: browse option switches to file browser view
- Browser selection: resolve git root, register project, create session
- Browser cancel (Esc): return to project picker
- Works from empty project list (browse is only option)

**Tests**:
- browse option opens file browser
- selection creates session with resolved path
- cancel returns to project picker
- browse works from empty project list

title: CLI Quick-Start Path Resolution
description:
portal open . and portal open <path> resolve directory without TUI. Validate existence, expand tilde, resolve relative paths.

**Do**:
- ResolvePath(arg): expand ~, resolve relative to absolute, validate
- IsPathArgument(arg): true if contains / or starts with . or ~
- Wire into portal open: if path arg, resolve and skip TUI
- Non-existent: print "Directory not found: {path}", exit 1
- Is file not dir: print error, exit 1

**Tests**:
- resolves relative path to absolute
- expands tilde to home directory
- returns error for non-existent path
- returns error when path is a file
- portal open . resolves cwd

title: CLI Quick-Start Session Creation
description:
Wire resolved path through git root, project registration, session naming, tmux creation, exec handoff.

**Do**:
- QuickStart(path): resolve git root -> register/update project -> generate name -> tmux new-session -> exec
- Reuse Phase 2 primitives (GitResolver, ProjectStore, SessionCreator)
- Update last_used if project already exists
- exec handoff same as TUI attach path

**Tests**:
- creates session with git-root-resolved directory
- registers new project in store
- updates last_used for existing project
- exec replaces process with tmux
